w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach hobbies and giving reasons by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: hobbies, fishing, hiking, puzzle, building, I like ____, I like ____ because ___, work, play, outside, inside,
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for hobbies and giving reasons
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: hobbies, fishing, hiking, puzzle, building
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about hobbies and giving reasons!”

Repeat the sentence: What is your opinion?
Explain to the student that an opinion is something you think or feel
about a situation, person, object, or activity.
Use the previous slide as an example: The boy mowing the lawn might have the opinion that mowing the lawn is fun. But your opinion is that mowing the lawn is boring!
